"I obtained it and I lost it again," he said. 

"Do you understand?" 

He sighed. "It was my fault. My weakness showed." 

They lived in a room at Amalia's. 

Dirt surrounded them. Disorder reigned. 

His daughter grew up, suffering under her stepmother. 

"Katerina Ivanovna is generous but irritable," he muttered. 

Sonia had no education. 

"I tried to teach her," he continued. 

"But we had no books." 

They stopped at Cyrus of Persia. 

Sonia read romantic books instead. 

"Can a respectable girl earn much?" he asked. 

"Not even fifteen farthings a day," he answered. 

"Only with honest work and no talent."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The narrator reflects on the struggles of his family, particularly the hardships faced by his daughter Sonia due to poverty and lack of education.
